command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 1 --------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $connection = Get-CrmConnection "Url=...; Domain=...; Username=...; Password=;" $currency = @{ "BaseCurrencyCode" = "EUR"; "BaseCurrencyName" = "euro"; "BaseCurrencyPrecision" = 2; "BaseCurrencySymbol" = "€" } # Note: use PowerShell ISE for unicode support New-CrmDeployment -DeploymentServiceConnection $connection -OrganizationName "AdventureWorks" -SqlServerName "crm2011" -SrsUrl" http://crm2011/reportserver" -Currency $currency -BaseLanguageCode "1036" -LanguageCode ("1033")

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Remove with blacklist filter --------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $connection = Get-CrmConnection "Url=...; Domain=...; Username=...; Password=;" $dataFile = "C:\Data\MyOrgData.zip" Remove-CrmContent -OrganizationServiceConnection $connection -DataFile $dataFile -Exclude ("customeraddress", "connection")

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Remove with whitelist filter --------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $connection = Get-CrmConnection "Url=...; Domain=...; Username=...; Password=;" $dataFile = "C:\Data\MyOrgData.zip" Remove-CrmContent -OrganizationServiceConnection $connection -DataFile $dataFile -Include ("account", "contact")

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an existing CRM organization.
Removes an existing CRM organization and drops the associated SQL database. Requires the SQLPS (SQL Server PowerShell) module.

The connection to the CRM deployment service.

The SQL authentication based credentials required for database removal.
Execute without user input.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 1 --------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $sqlCredential = Get-Credential $connection = Get-CrmConnection "Url=...; Domain=...; Username=...; Password=;" $organizationid = Get-CrmEntityInstanceId "AdventureWorks" Remove-CrmDeployment -Connection $connection -EntityInstanceId $organizationid -SqlCredential $sqlCredential

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Deserialize entities from file --------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $retrieveEntityResponse = Invoke-CrmOrganizationService -Connection $orgConnection -RequestName "RetrieveEntity" -Parameters @{ "LogicalName" = "contact"; "EntityFilters" = [Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Metadata.EntityFilters]::Attributes; "RetrieveAsIfPublished" = $false; MetadataId = [System.Guid]::Empty } $em = $retrieveEntityResponse.Results["EntityMetadata"]
$entities = Get-Content "C:\Content\contact.json" -Raw ConvertFrom-CrmJson $entities "Microsoft.Xrm.Sdk.Entity[]" -EntityMetadata $em | Format-CrmEntity

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Export by custom FetchXML --------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $queries = @" <queries> <fetch mapping="logical"> <entity name="account"> <all-attributes /> </entity> </fetch> <fetch mapping="logical"> <entity name="appointment"> <all-attributes /> </entity> </fetch> </queries> "@
Export-CrmContent -Connection $orgConnection -ContentFetchXml $queries

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Connection from connectionstring --------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $credential = Get-Credential $domain = $credential.GetNetworkCredential().Domain $username = $credential.GetNetworkCredential().Username $password = $credential.GetNetworkCredential().Password
Get-CrmConnection "Url=$deploymentServiceUrl; Domain=$domain; Username=$username; Password=$password;"

Imports entities to an organization from a data file.
The data .zip file (or data folder for uncompressed input).
The .json output file that captures the target organizations plugin-step, workflow, and organization state prior to import. Only takes effect when the 'IgnorePlugins' switch is false.
Ignore existing entities (do not match entities by Id) and create duplicate entities.

Performs a single-threaded import. Note: Multi-threaded imports are always disabled when the cmdlet is invoked under a PowerShell runspace (since the TPL is not available). Multithreading is only available when invoked under a standard CLR app domain.
Entities that already exist in the target CRM organization that match entities in the source data are updated according to the source data.
Suppresses the initial CRM organization confirmation prompt for non-interactive imports.
Causes plugins, duplicate detection, and auditing to be unchanged during import. Normally these features are temporarily disabled for import.
Creates and enables a performance counter to measure service call rate. Category name: 'Adxstudio' Counter name: 'Organization Service Calls Per Second'.
Causes all system user values to be remapped to the current deployment administrator user.
Enables detailed host output tracing.
Disables entity order optimization to use the original file system order.
The set of entity logical names indicating the entities to omit during import.
Errors that can be ignored to allow the import to continue.
The set of system user attributes used to match users in the data against users in the target organization.
The maximum number of concurrent connections allowed. Not applicable when cmdlet is invoked under a PowerShell runspace.
The number of entities to retrieve on each fetch request.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Update trace settings --------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $emptyId = Get-CrmEntityInstanceId -Id ([System.Guid]::Empty) $trace = Get-CrmDeploymentEntity -Connection $deployConnection -DeploymentEntityType TraceSettings -EntityInstanceId $emptyId $trace.Categories = "*:Error" $trace.Enabled = $true
Set-CrmDeploymentEntity -Connection $deployConnection -Entity $trace
